tool.name: Filter FASTQ by ID

param.name: input_fastq
param.label: FASTQ file to filter on the identifiers

param.name: columns
param.label: Column(s) containing FASTA identifiers
param.help: Multi-select list - hold the appropriate key while clicking to select multiple columns

param.name: output_choice
param.label: Output positive matches, negative matches, or both?
param.option: Both positive matches (ID on list) and negative matches (ID not on list), as two FASTA files
Just positive matches (ID on list), as a single FASTA file
Just negative matches (ID not on list), as a single FASTA file

tool.help:
**What it does**
By default it divides a FASTQ file in two, those sequences with or without an ID present in the tabular file column(s) specified. You can opt to have a single output file of just the matching records, or just the non-matching ones.
Note that the order of sequences in the original FASTA file is preserved. Also, if any sequences share an identifier, duplicates are not removed.
**Example Usage**
You may have performed some kind of contamination search, for example running BLASTN against a database of cloning vectors or bacteria, giving you a tabular file containing read identifiers. You could use this too to extract only the reads without BLAST matches (i.e. those which do not match your contaminant database).
